pli-tv-kd1:20.7.3.pli: “Gaccha tvaṁ, kassapa, āyāmahan”ti uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā “jambudīpo” paññāyati, tato phalaṁ gahetvā paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd1:20.7.3.en: “You just go ahead, Kassapa, I’ll come.” After dismissing him, he took a fruit from a rose-apple tree—the tree after which the Rose-apple Land of India is named—and then arrived first in the fire hut, where he sat down.

pli-tv-kd1:20.9.6.pli: “mahiddhiko kho mahāsamaṇo mahānubhāvo, yatra hi nāma maṁ paṭhamataraṁ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā ‘jambudīpo’ paññāyati, tato phalaṁ gahetvā paṭhamataraṁ āgantvā agyāgāre nisīdissati, na tveva ca kho arahā yathā ahan”ti.
pli-tv-kd1:20.9.6.en: “The Great Ascetic is powerful and mighty, in that he dismissed me, then took a fruit from a rose-apple tree, and still arrived first in the fire hut. But he’s not a perfected one like me.”

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.3.pli: “Gaccha tvaṁ, kassapa, āyāmahan”ti uruvelakassapaṁ jaṭilaṁ uyyojetvā yāya jambuyā “jambudīpo” paññāyati, tassā avidūre ambo …pe…
pli-tv-kd1:20.10.3.en: “You just go ahead, Kassapa, I’ll come.” After dismissing him, he took a fruit from a mango tree not far from the rose-apple tree …

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.4.en: he took a fruit from an emblic myrobalan tree not far from the rose-apple tree …

pli-tv-kd1:20.10.5.en: he took a fruit from a chebulic myrobalan tree not far from the rose-apple tree …

sn48.67:1.1.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ye keci jambudīpakā rukkhā, jambū tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati;
sn48.67:1.1.en: “Mendicants, of all the trees in India, the rose-apple is said to be the best.

sn48.67:1.9.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ye keci jambudīpakā rukkhā, jambū tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati;
sn48.67:1.9.en: Of all the trees in India, the rose-apple is said to be the best.

Linked Discourses 48
7. Leading to Awakening
67. A Tree (1st)

Verses of the Senior Monks
The Book of the Fours
Chapter One
4.11. Sappaka

mn36:31.2.pli: ‘abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ pitu sakkassa kammante sītāya jambucchāyāya nisinno vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharitā.
mn36:31.2.en: ‘I recall sitting in the cool shade of the rose-apple tree while my father the Sakyan was off working. Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

pli-tv-kd6:35.6.3.pli: ambapānaṁ jambupānaṁ cocapānaṁ mocapānaṁ madhūkapānaṁ muddikapānaṁ sālūkapānaṁ phārusakapānaṁ.
pli-tv-kd6:35.6.3.en: mango drinks, rose-apple drinks, drinks from bananas with seeds, drinks from seedless bananas, licorice drinks, grape drinks, drinks made from lotus tubers, falsa fruit drinks.
